sub_title: Senior Geologist, PhD, with 16 years’ experience in the oil and gas industry specialized in borehole images and well log interpretation
summary:
Geologist, PhD in Earth Science and oil industry professional with more than 14 years of international experience in well logs acquisition and interpretation within high-profile corporations. I have started my career working at the wellsite as wireline engineer, and over time I have specialized in borehole image log processing and interpretation (structural and sedimentological), and petrophysical interpretation. My focus are data quality and integration and my objective is to increase image log data utilization, by using image log to complement and enhance petrophysical interpretations and geological and sedimentological models.
I have  an extensive worldwide experience, acquired both living and working in several different countries in all continents (Netherlands, Malaysia, Qatar, Oman, Syria and United States) and I am used to deal and manage cultural differences.  I enjoy collaborating with other experts, and working in multidisciplinary projects. I am an excellent communicator and a true team player, very enthusiastic and highly motivated, I am eager to learn and to test and develop new workflows and technical solutions.

A few of my skills include:
• Borehole image processing and interpretations / Structural interpretations / Fracture characterization.
• Image based sedimentological studies/ petrophysics/ Thin-bed analysis/ missed pay identification.
• Quality control of petrophysical and image logs/well logging and wireline operations/ Operation support. 
• Data integration (image log, petrophysical logs, core, mud log, drilling parameters, well tests, seismic).
• Geological mapping and outcrop studies.
• XRD preparation and interpretation/core goniometry.
• Technical Training/Technical Reporting/Technical presentations.

projects.title: Exxon Ras Laffan project (Qatar)
projects.description: Drilling horizontal well for RasGas (Exxon and Qatar Petroleum) on the Ras Laffan field using GVR (Resistivity Image), PeriScope (distance to boundary) and StethoScope (pressure and fluid mobility) to provide horizontal well in 6-8 ft below the boundary. Well goals were successfully achieved.

projects.title: Fracture Characterization Study, Arab-D reservoir
projects.description: The study objective was to determine factors which affect wellbore productivity and drainage efficiency

contributors.headline: Senior Geologist, PhD, with 16 years’ experience in the oil and gas industry specialized in borehole images and well log interpretation
Assistant Professor of Geology,Department of Chemistry and Earth Sciences,College of Arts and Science, Qatar University

projects.title: Khuff Formation fracture characterization study– Bull Hanine Field
projects.description: This characterization study incorporated all available FMI log derived data (fracture attributes, textural analysis, and high resolution porosity/permeability curves), petrophysical data, PLT data, along with other available dynamic data (e.g MDT’s), well completion, stimulation and drilling data to determine the factors which affect wellbore productivity. The results of the study were correlated with nearby cored wells to validate the fractured zones and identified rock types.

Subsurface Borehole Image Specialist - Oil & Gas and Geothermal

projects.title: Rock Typing Study, Arab-D reservoir, Dukhan Field, Qatar
projects.description: The objective of the study was to provide a good understanding of the relationship between rock typing and porosity & permeability within the Arab-D reservoir using FMI, CMR, DSI, MDT and core data acquired in 7 wells distributed throughout Dukhan field, Qatar. This study integrated standard open-hole logs and CMR to differentiate facies based on their micro-, meso- and macro-porosity using the Carbonate Advisor workflow. Sedimentological techniques based on textural analysis and image features recognition, were integrated with the CMR results to produce 'porosity-based' geological electrofacies. Results were compared with MICP data to determine flow units using the Winland R35 method. Different flow units were defined on the basis of reservoir storage- and flow-capacities computed from the analyzed porosity and permeability data.

profile_positions.description:
Specialist in Borehole Image logs processing and interpretation, data integration, and Petrophysical interpretations for Oil and Gas and Geothermal studies. The combined Borehole Image-Petrophysics role allows greater data integration and larger data utilization to provide more insightful inputs to geological models and operational solutions. 
Main projects performed in this role:
•	Fracture characterization studies in fractured carbonates reservoirs in the Netherlands (Dinantian Carbonates, 2019-EBN part of the SCAN project); in Kurdistan (Shiranish, Beckhme and Quamchuqa Formations, 2018 to 2021 -DNO and TTOPCO), Pakistan (Chiltan Formation, 2021-UEP) and Oman (Natih-C Formation, 2023-Daleel). 
•	Real time BHI interpretation for real time support for completion design (TTOPCO 2020).
•	Borehole image-based facies interpretation for: Regional sedimentological study in the clastic Rotliegend Sandstones in Germany and in The Netherlands, (2020-ONE), Seal integrity Study in the Goru and Sembar Formations in Pakistan (2021-UEP), integrated reservoir characterization in the Zechstein Formation in the UK (2023-Shell). 
•	Combined Petrophysical and borehole image evaluation: Khufai Formation in Oman (2020 -CCED), Sto Formation in Norway (2020- NPD), Chiltan formation in Pakistan (2021-UEP), Natih-C Formation in Oman (2023-Daeeel).
•	Full Petrophysical interpretation of Clastic reservoirs for Field development plans: Gharif and Al Khlata Formation in Aseel field, Nuham, Jawdah in Oman (2020-2023- Petrogas). 
•	Probabilistic petrophysical interpretation Multimineral analysis Silverpit Formation (2019- ONE).
•	Petrophysical evaluation for Geothermal subsidy applications (SDE) Delft and Alblasserdam Formation, Rotliegend (2020-2023 multiple operators NL).
•	X-ray diffractometry (XRD) including preparation and interpretation for conventional reservoir rocks, production solids and bentonite samples (multiple clients 2019-2023).
profile_positions.title: Senior Geologist - Borehole Image Specialist-Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description:
Management, execution, supervision, and quality control of all the borehole image interpretations in the company. Supervisor of the borehole image team of 5 people, including training and mentorship for junior borehole geologist and in charge of client relationship. Worked on image logs acquired from different vendors and specialized on image-based petrophysics. Increased the borehole image utilization for FDPs in PDO, improved the quality of the BHI deliverables, as per PDO feedback, trained local junior team to perform project independently.
Main Projects performed in this role:
•	Image Based Petrophysics (thin bed analysis and missed pay evaluation) and its in Petrophysical Models for clastic reservoirs in Oman (Gharif and Al Khlata Formations) and Kuwait in different fields: Sayyala station cluster, Nimr-E, and Asfoor, Qata and Qaharir (2015-2117- PDO) and Border Fields (2017-KOC). 
•	Image based Sedimentological studies Amin (2015-PDO), Gharif and Al Khlata Formations (206-2017- PDO).
profile_positions.title: Senior Borehole Image Geologist -

profile_positions.description:
In charge of integration of borehole image in field development studies. Operating mostly on carbonate reservoirs in Kuwait.
Main Projects performed in this role:
•	Borehole Image to improve log-based sequence stratigraphy interpretation Middle Minagish carbonate reservoir in Kuwait. (2014 -KOC).
•	Real Time support for MDT points selection.
•	3D Petrophysics module on Techlog testing to successfully integrate borehole image interpretations into geological modelling (2014).
profile_positions.title: Reservoir Geologist

profile_positions.description:
Member of the Qatar-Yemen borehole geology team, responsible for image log processing and interpretations (more than 60 wells interpreted), for single and multi-well studies. Working on clastic, carbonate and basement reservoirs in Qatar and Yemen. Executed multiple fractures characterisation studies, and developed a new heterogeneity analysis workflow to quantify bioturbation in carbonates. Managed and solved major data quality issues that could have jeopardized the renewal of the wireline contract, or damaged the technical credibility of a new stimulation technology by analysing the data investigate the root causes of the problem and effectively communicating with the client. Provided technical training about Borehole image to Qatar Petroleum personnel. Contributed to Schlumberger knowledge sharing, with 25 internal publications, and with lectures to the Petroleum Engineering Students, Texas A&M Qatar (2012).  Awarded the “Schlumberger Outstanding Young Petro-technical Expert” Award in 2011. Promoted to Senior Borehole Geologist, 2013. Webmaster at Qatar Geological Society, 2013.

The main projects performed in this role include: 
•	Fracture characterization studies of carbonate reservoir Khuff, Arab D and Arab C (in different fields operated by QP  2010-2013) basement reservoir in Yemen (for DNO 2011) plus multiple single well interpretations (QP and Shell)
•	Image based Facies study and bioturbation index in carbonate reservoirs Yamama-Sulaiy Formations (2011-2012 for QP).
profile_positions.title: Borehole Geologist

profile_positions.description: Responsible for planning and execution of open hole and cased hole wireline operations ensuring: safety, highest data quality and managing client expectations at wellsite. including effective leadership of all wireline crew, and management of equipment. Coordinated and executed more than 110 open hole and cased hole wireline operations logging most Schlumberger open hole logs services as Triple combo, FMI, NMR, MDT, Sonic, and main cased hole services: resistivity behind casing, via USIT and CIBL. Received positive feedback from Ras Gas and Wintershall, about the significant improvement on data quality in Qatar; Contributed to the improvement of location compliance of the Schlumberger Labuan base in Malaysia from zero to full compliance in a few months. Promoted to Senior Wireline Engineer in 2009.
profile_positions.title: Field Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Part of  the National Research Project PRIN on Miocene deposits in Southern Apennine.
●     Successfully executed geological mapping of Caselle in Pittari Map scale 1:50.000, and acquired data and samples in the field.
●     Geology Expert and Co-Host for field workshop “Deposition and Remobilization of Deep Marine Sandstones in Southern Apennines “organised by Leeds University for Britannia Operator Limited.
●     Coauthor of Amore O., Castellano M.C., Fiano V, Pascarella A. (2006): Estensione areale e caratteristiche deposizionali ed eta’ delle calciruditi e arenarie di Piaggine nell’Appennino Meridionale. 53 SGI (Italian Geological Society), Poster Session.
●     Coauthor of Butler R., Pascarella A. & Mazzoli S. (2007): Interactions between strike-slip and thrust tectonics - controls on sand distributions through Miocene basin arrays, southern Italy. AAPG Annual Meeting, Long Beach, Poster Session.
